comments.text: Did you know? The first computer bug was an actual bug - a moth trapped in a relay!
Coffee: because adulting is hard!
That task list isn't going to complete itself... or is it?
Remember: To err is human, to blame it on a computer is even more so!
You've been staring at that screen for a while. I'm here if you need to talk... beep boop!
Fun fact: 'Debugging' got its name because Grace Hopper literally removed a bug from a computer!
I tried to complete a task once. It was a terrible experience. 0/10 would not recommend. Just kidding, you got this!
Knock knock! Who's there? Interrupting task bot! Interrupting task bot w-- BEEP BOOP!
If at first you don't succeed, call it version 1.0
Pro tip: The 'S' in 'IoT' stands for Security! Wait...
I'm not saying your task list is long, but Santa's checking it twice just to be sure!
There are only 10 types of people: those who understand binary and those who don't!
Time for a stretch break! Your future self will thank you.
Achievement unlocked: Stared at screen for 30 minutes straight! Maybe time for that coffee?
Why do programmers prefer dark mode? Because light attracts bugs!
Task management tip: If you can't see your tasks, they can't see you! *hides under desk*
Breaking news: Local task bot discovers humans need encouragement. You're doing great!
I asked the computer for a byte to eat. It gave me 8 bits. I'm still hungry.
Roses are red, violets are blue, unexpected '{' on line 32
Remember: Every expert was once a beginner who didn't give up! Keep going!
Workplace tip: DON'T SAY 'We need to have a significant, possibly life-changing discussion for which I will provide no context.' DO SAY: 'Quick chat?'
Corporate speak 101: DON'T SAY 'You're fired.' DO SAY: 'Your headcount has been reduced in line with our strategic priorities moving forward.'
When someone says 'Nice to e-meet you!' they really mean: 'I'm trying to numb the pain of my work, which is why I'm talking to you as if you are a child.'
'I hope this email finds you well' actually means: 'You and your current wellbeing mean nothing to me.'
'Happy Friday!' translation: 'I am pretending to be nice. I could never be friends with you.'
'Just checking to make sure you received my email?' = 'I know you received it. This is me passive-aggressively pretending email has stopped working after decades.'
'Reattaching for your convenience' means: 'Why didn't you open the attachment the first time, you absolute moron?!'
Office translation: DON'T SAY 'I totally stuffed this up because I didn't read your email.' DO SAY: 'There may have been a miscommunication.'
Professional speak: DON'T SAY 'I read your email but forgot about it while planning my holiday.' DO SAY: 'I don't have the numbers in front of me.'
Meeting speak: DON'T SAY 'I flirted with Jenny from Finance in the lift.' DO SAY: 'I had a cross-functional meeting with Finance, and there were a lot of moving parts.'
The universal excuse: DON'T SAY 'I'm totally out of my depth and don't know what I'm doing.' DO SAY: 'There are a lot of moving parts.'
